original_title: If I could name you myself (I would hold you forever)
overview: Wake and soil, skin and voice: Hope Strickland's film locates a legacy of slavery and colonial exploitation beneath the archive's official chronicle, in the deep historical memory of the body. "If I could name you myself (I would hold you forever)" sings an alternate history of resistanceâ€”familial, elemental, and sensuous.
title: If I could name you myself (I would hold you forever)
